description.p: Although they lost much in the Fall, humans remain the dominant race on Tal Ahmur. Whether they seek to survive in the ruins of their once-great kingdom of Caladon, the savage frontier of the Verge, or the decadent city states of the Nightlands, humans refuse to let their time be past.
It’s hard to make generalizations about humans, but your human character has these traits.

Age.Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.
Alignment.Humans tend toward no particular alignment. The best and the worst are found among them.
Size.Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Speed.Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Languages.You can speak, read, and write Common.
Ethnicity.Human traits further depend on the culture in which they were raised. Select one of the following ethnicities to gain additional traits: Caladonian, Mehrani, Chaskan, Surati, or other.

description.p: You consider yourself of mixed or indeterminate heritage. While this could mean your parents were of two different ethnic backgrounds, it could also reflect an upbringing that wasn't strongly influenced by any one culture for other reasons. Maybe you were raised in a cosmopolitan city, or moved around frequently during your formative years. Maybe you didn't care for or actively rebelled against local cultural norms. Whatever the reason, it has made you highly adaptable and versatile.

Ability Score Increase.Your ability scores each increase by 1.
Skills.You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.
Tools.You gain proficiency in one set of tools of your choice.
Languages.You can speak, read, and write two additional standard languages of your choice.

Caladonians are tall, fair-skinned folk with blue or steely gray eyes. Most have blond hair, but brown and red are also common. They are known as industrious and driven (or just plain stubborn, depending on who you ask).
Caladonians can be found all over the Afterworld, though they are most common in the east.

Caladonian Names:(Male) Darvin, Dorn, Evendur, Geth, Helm, Malcer, Morn, Randal, Stedd; (female) Amafrey, Arveene, Esvele, Jhessail, Kerri, Lureene, Miri, Rowan, Shandri, Tessele; (surnames) Amblecrown, Buckman, Dundragon, Evenwood, Greycastle, Tallstag

Ability Score Increase.Your Strength, Intelligence, and one other ability score of your choice each increase by 1.
Feat.You gain one feat for which you meet the prerequisites.
Skills.You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.
Languages.You can speak, read, and write Caladonian.

Shorter and slighter in build than most other humans, the Mehrani have dusky brown skin and hair, and eyes ranging from brown to orange or green. They are often thought of as a passionate and quick-witted people, and are found primarily in the city states of the south.

Mehrani Names:(Male) Aseir, Bardeid, Diero, Marcon, Mehmen, Sudeiman, Zasheir; (female) Atala, Ceidil, Hama, Jasmal, Meilil, Selise, Yasheira, Zasheida; (surnames) Basha, Dumein, Jassan, Khalid, Mostana, Pashar, Rein

Skills.You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.
Languages.You can speak, read, and write Mehrani.

The Chaska are the aboriginal inhabitants of Tal Ahmur, their bronze skin ranges from a lighter coppery hue to deep brown. Their hair tends to be wavy or curly, and from black to brown. They have strong, broad faces and sturdy builds. Chaskan culture has strong ties to the natural world. They can be most commonly found in the north and west.

p.span: Chaskan Names:(Male) Ahanu, Ehan, Kanuna, Lusion, Soyala, Tuari, Whakan; (female) Boniwa, Jennesee, Kamali, Nirvelli, Sunki, Talita. There are no traditional Chaskan surnames.

Dominant in the southwestern desert of Akain, the Surat are generally tall, slim, and amber-skinned, with eyes of hazel or brown. Their hair ranges from black to dark brown. They have high cheek bones and high-bridged noses. The Surat are a dutiful people that are rarely found outside their lands.
